title: Russia’s Military, Natural Gas Make Japan Cautious About U.S.-Led Sanctions
sub_head: Moscow’s warships and live-fire drills around disputed islands add to pressure on Tokyo
body:
The U.S. campaign for a broad alliance to deter Russia is facing headwinds in Japan, which relies on Russian energy imports and wants to keep talks alive with Moscow over disputed islands.
Russia is pressuring Japan not to join potential Western sanctions in the event of an invasion of Ukraine. It is conducting military drills on islands seized by Soviet forces from Japan in 1945, after deploying troops and missile bases there in recent years.
